Posts.Content: SueJR wrote: I would like to say hello to everyone, I am very new to this site.  I found a lump some months ago, and ignored it.  However it did not go away and I thought it best to have it checked out.  I was sent to see a consultant who sent me for a mammorgram and ultra sound.  The lump did not show, good news I thought!  No, the Consultant said as we could both feel this lump, which is quite big! I would have to have the lump removed and sent for a biopsy.  He told me to come back in two months, that was one month ago, the longest month of my life.  I am trying not to worry as I think all the signs are positive, but of course there is always the doubt.  Has this ever happened to anyone? What was the outcome, as I am imagining all sorts of things Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2012 09:50AM SueJR wrote: Hi thatsvanity, It has been the waiting that is driving me nuts!  I am so glad I took everyone's advice and had the appointment moved.  I will still have to wait for the biopsy though, hopefully that will not be too long after the appointment with the Consultant.  I am still hopeful that the lump is nothing to worry about, I just want to put all this behind me. I am really glad that your lump did not turn out to be cancer.   I will keep everyone posted.
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 12:59AM SueJR wrote: Hi cycle path,   Yes I am in the UK.  I am really very new to this and not yet used to the terminology, or procedures.  I have noticed though, a lot of ladies talk of MRI scans as part of the procedures.  This has never been mentioned as an option to me!  Although my lump can be felt easily by myself and the Consultant, he wants to see me now on the 13th Jan (Iguess to see if it is still there! it is!) he has already said the lump will be removed for biopsy.  I do not know if he means all the lump or just some of it.  These are questions I will have to ask on the 13th.  Anyway he has never mentioned an MRI scan, which perhaps would show the lump and what it is?
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 09:58AM SueJR wrote: Hi Amy Lynn, thanks for keeping me company through this,  I will see my Consultant next friday 13th Jan, hopefully I will get the date for my biopsy soon after, I already know it will be a surgical procedure as he said there will be a scar, plus the lump did not show up on mammorgram or ultra sound. I find it really helpful just to keep visiting the site and talking to everyone. Of course as soon as I know the results of anything I will keep you posted Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2012 03:44AM SueJR wrote: Hi Kingjr66, thank you so much for replying.  I am feeling quite alone at the moment.  I decided not to say anything to my grown up children before Christmas, I did not want them to worry. I also think 2 months is an awful long time to wait.  I think, like you, the Consultant may be waiting to see if there are any changes.  The lump is still there though and just as big! I am trying to stay positive, I keep telling myself all the signs are good, but I know there is a possibilty of there being something more serious. I am just taking one day at a time, and also taking comfort that there are people who know what I am going through. I am sorry your results were not what you hoped for. I will keep in touch and let you know what my results are.  Thanks again for replying.  Much love and hugs
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 09:53AM SueJR wrote: Hi cycle path,  I am so glad I found this site, I find it reassuring just to talk to people with the same situation. I realise things may be done differently in the Uk but people's feelings and expereience are the same everywhere. Thanks for all the info about removing the lump I found that really informative and thank you for replying it means a lot to me.  I find myself coming back to the site many times for reassurance. It is making the wait more bearable, many thanks
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2012 12:17AM SueJR wrote: Hi cycle path, Thank you for replying ,It is the waiting that is driving me nuts.  I did ask why I was being left two months, as I had an hysterectomy ten years ago and do not have periods.  As I still have my ovaries I was told 2 months was not an unreasonable time to wait to see if there were any changes. He explained that this was my first visit to see him and it was only a snapshot.  I explained that I had the lump for a number of months and nothing had changed and as the lump was going to be removed for testing please do it now.  He said he understood how I was feeling but said he wanted to wait. When I was leaving he said 'try not to worry' oh yeah, easier said than done.  Probably ruined my whole Christmas.
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2012 07:53AM SueJR wrote: Hi everyone, I have taken all your advice and phoned the Breast Clinic this morning, explaining that the waiting was driving me nuts.  The nurse agreed with me and has moved my appointment forward to the 13th Jan (still 2 weeks to go but better than first appointment) Once I have seen the Consultant I will have a date for my biopsy. I will keep you all posted.
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 01:41AM SueJR wrote: Hi Lucille, Thanks for replying,  you say you had a lumpectomy, does this mean they removed all of the lump to be tested because your lump, like mine, did not show on mammorgram or ultra sound? I am a bit confused as to what my Consultlant means by removing the lump for biopsy.  I know it will be a surgical procedure as he said I would have a scar!  Sorry you had bad news, but really glad they caught it early.  I am still going nuts with this waiting game! I would rather know what I am dealing with one way or another!
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 10:02AM SueJR wrote: Hi spanish eyes,  I agree with you I cannot complain about the treatment in the UK and we are very lucky we do not have the added worry of paying for treatment.  As I have said earlier it is really good to have people who are going through the same things to talk to.  I felt alone at the beginning, not wantng to tell my family and upset their Christmas.  My husband knows but he is a worrier and that makes me feel guilty, so I try not to talk to him too much about my fears and all the what ifs!!  I know if the outcome is not what I hoped for there are people out there who will support me through as they have the waiting game. I hope the ultra sound on your liver turns out to be ok.  I will be thinking of you Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2012 03:28PM SueJR wrote: Hi Crystalred7 I have been in a very similar position.  I too had a palpable lump that did not show up on either mammorgram or ultrasound.  My consultant left me for 2 months (the waiting was awful!) then decided to do an exisional biopsy. The fact that the lump did not show up is probably a good sign.  I have had the biopsy and get the results next Friday.  I will let you know how I get on.  Please do not give up. I will be thinking of you Hugs and loves SueJR
Posts.Title: will they biopsy? crystalred7 mittmott

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2012 12:26AM SueJR wrote: Hi Caren, Thank you for replying.  I first went for a routine mammorgram two years ago, at the time I thought I could feel a small lump and mentioned it.  I was sent for an ultra sound as well and nothing showed. I was told it was nothing to worry about and basically forget it!  So I did!  Then about six months ago I noticed the lump (if it is the same one) was still there but bigger and more easily felt.  I did not tell anyone not wanting to overreact, (plus my husband is a real worrier) but then I mentioned it to my sister who felt the lump and marched me straight to the Doctors who could feel the lump and within three days I had an appointment with a Breast Consultant.  Again I was sent for mammorgram and ultra sound and again nothing showed up.  I thought that would be the end of it, but no, the Consultant said that as he could feel the lump it would have to be taken out and tested, to come back in two months.  It is the two months bit that is driving me insane.  I will keep you posted as to how I get on.  I do realise that although the lump did not show it still could be cancer and I just want to find out what it is so I can deal with it.  I am so glad that you are now doing great, it must have been one hell of a journey. Thank you for keeping me compnay my journey.
Posts.Title: Lump not detected by mammorgram SueJR SueJR

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2012 12:08PM SueJR wrote: Hi Dee Seaview, I am waiting for an excisonal biopsy because of an undiagnosed lump in the breast.  The lump did not show up on mammorgram or ultrasound.  My Consultant has indicated that it could be fibrocystic change, which I understand to be a lump of fatty tissue which forms into a hard lump but is benign. He cannot be 100% certain, hence the biopsy.  With saying all that, it does not sound what you are describing.  I think you are righ to ask for a second opinion. Let me know how you get on  Sue
Posts.Title: Is it fybrocystic?? DeeSeaview farmerlucy

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2012 01:22PM SueJR wrote: Hi everyone, I just thought I would say hello, I am still finding it difficult playing the waiting game.  Some days I can forget about it only for it to pop back into my head. Just wish it was all over and I knew what I was facing (if anything!)  Hope everyone is ok Sue xxx

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2012 08:43AM SueJR wrote: Hi everyone,  I had my results today B9 tumour.  HOOOORAAAY!!!!! When I saw my Consultant he said the lump was a tumour but benign!  He said it was a lipoma and could have appeared anywhere on the body.   I pointed out that I still had a large hard lump around the scar, he said that my breast was still very swollen but this would settle down. He also said that he had taken out all the lump and it would not grow back.  Has anyone else had anything similar? Thank you everyone for your support I could have not have done it without you all Much love and hugs. I will be thinking positive thoughts for you all xxx
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2012 11:51AM SueJR wrote: Hi Ocalagal, Please can I be your waiting buddy.  I am in a similar situation. I saw a Breast Consultant about one month ago after finding a lump. I actually found the lump sometime ago but did not tell anyone! I was sent for a mammorgram and ultra sound, the lump did not show up. The Consultant  wants to wait until end of Jan (Far too long for me) to see if there are any changes (there haven't been) before sending me for a biopsy. I did not tell my grown up children as I did not want to spoil their Christmas and New Year, only my husband and two sisters. I am so fully of questions, I am trying to stay positive and trying not to worry until I have the results of the biopsy, but this is impopssible.  I really do need a buddy at the moment please stay in touch xxx

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2012 07:36AM SueJR wrote: Hi Judy, Thank you, this means a lot to me.  I go back to see the Consultant on Friday the 13th!!!! It has been the waiting that has been driving me insane, and of course I keep going on to different sites to see if anyone else is in the same position, a lump that is now showing on ultra shoud.  There are quite a few, and sometimes it has turned out to be something serious.  I just want to know one way or the other so I can move on.  Everyone has been brilliant and it has been a comfort knowing people are willing to listen and do not think I am over reacting.  Thank you again for caring Sue xxx

Hoping for good results for all of us  Sue xxx

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2012 01:21PM - edited Jan 13, 2012 01:22PM by SueJR Hi big,   Fantastic news!  I am so pleased for you!  After seeing the Consultant today, I am still playing the waiting game! He has said the lump has got to come out, the date is 8th Feb.  Like you I will have an exc.biopsy and  I am hoping it will also be fibrous fatty tissue.  My lump is quite big and I cannot understand why nothing has shown up. I am going to need all my friends for a bit longer yet.  Thank you all so much for being there! I suppose I am a bit scared (probably being a wimp!) about the biopsy, I know it will be done under general anaesthetic and I have been told threre will be about a 2" scar,  and the dressing will be on for 10 days, so it looks like a few days off work at least.  I will then have to wait for the results probably about 1 week. I hate this waiting game. Andrea, Thank you for all your kind thoughts and please let me know how you get on. Leneza, How did you get on?  I have been thinking of you, I am praying you have good news!     Thinking of you all, and hoping for good news for everyone! Much love as always  Sue xxx
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 09:49AM SueJR wrote: Hi Sandi, Thanks, it feels scary.  I will know more after my appointment next week.  Thank you for the hugs, I need them at the moment Sue
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2012 05:10AM SueJR wrote: Hi Andrea, The consultant examined me, felt the lump again, and said 'it has to come out'  He went on to explain the procedure and why they were doing it.  Because it is an unexplained lump it has to be fully investigated.  He has had a couple of unexplained lumps when tested turn out to be tumours, but the odds are it is fibrous change (that is what I am telling myself!) but he has to be 100% certain!  I think if he was 100% certain it was just fibrous tissue he would not be doing the biopsy!  So the waiting game continues.  It is a very difficult time for us all, and I do find  it hard to concentrate in work. I just want it to be all over and put it behind me.  I find it really helpful talking to everyone, it is what is getting me through this right now.  I do not want to talk to my family, I do not want to worry them. Thanks everyone Love & Hugs as always Sue
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2012 01:05PM - edited Feb 5, 2012 01:06PM by SueJR Hi everyone, My waiting is nearly over, I go for my excisonal biopsy on Wednesday.  The waiting has been horrendous, I have not been able to concentrate on anything this week!  I have to admit I am feeling really nervous.  I have been told I wil be left with a two - three inch scar and I am expecting to be left feeling pretty sore.  I will then have to wait 10 - 14 days for the results.  MORE WAITING!!!  I am feeling pretty sorry for myself at the moment, and then feel like an idiot for being such a wimp!  It has been a really stressful time.  Thank you everyone for being there for me and just listening.  Will let you all know how I get on.  Much love, Sue xxx
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya
